description.text:
Immersive Music Hackathon
The Monthly Music Hackathon series presents our Immersive Music Hackathon:  a day-long, non-competitive, creative event exploring immersive music in virtual and real environments.

Saturday, December 9, 2017
Noon to 10:00 PM625 6th Ave 2nd FloorNew York, NY 10011FREE. All are welcome!

Schedule:
11:30 AM - Doors Open12:00 PM - Opening Talks by Special Guests1:00 PM - Hacking, Brainstorming session2:00 PM - Workshops start8:00 PM - Concert / Demos

Talks
12:00 - 1:30 PM

Ken Perlin - The Use of Music and Audio in Immersive Live VR Theater
Pran Brandi - Introduction to Immersive Audio
Brad Garton, Ethan Edwards & Onur Yıldırım - Integrated Music Generation and Interactive Synthesis
Dana Abrassart - Mind, Body, & Sound
Charles Berman - Immersive Performance

 
VR Playground2:00 - 5:00Audio Fusion Recording Studio Simulation with Sam Fisher, and other demos
 
Workshops
2:00 - 3:30 - Pran BrandiIntroduction to immersive audio.This workshop introduces techniques for approaching spacial audio, including ambisonics, plugins, and DAW workflow. It is recommended to download the following free software before the workshop:


Reaper
Unity 2017.1 or newer
FB360 Spacial Workstation (v3.0.0 is ideal, but v2.2.1 is fine if their OS is older)
Resonance Audio Unity package (just the .unitypackage file is necessary)
Resonance Audio VST plugin
Ambix VST plugins (just 1st order is necessary)


2:00 - 3:30 - Brad Garton, Ethan Edwards & Onur YıldırımUsing RTcmix in the Unity Game Development Environment (intermediate level)
4:00 - 5:30 - Nicole SteinWebVR: Introduction to building VR with A-Frame
4:00 - 5:30 - Brennan McTernanHow spatial audio works, the kinds of microphones and how they work, and how our ears tell our eyes where to look. Attendees should install (free) Unity 2017.2, and bring a laptop with headphones.
 
Demos and Performances8:00 Presentations and sharing what we made over the course of the day
 
Stay tuned to our blog, twitter, or facebook for more announcements!
Wanna get involved? Here's our volunteer interest form.
Join the announcements mailing list
monthlymusichackathon.org@musichackathonfacebook.com/musichackathon
#Immersive #MusicHackathon
description.html:
Immersive Music Hackathon

The Monthly Music Hackathon series presents our Immersive Music Hackathon:  a day-long, non-competitive, creative event exploring immersive music in virtual and real environments.


Saturday, December 9, 2017

Noon to 10:00 PM
625 6th Ave 2nd Floor
New York, NY 10011
FREE. All are welcome!


Schedule:

11:30 AM - Doors Open
12:00 PM - Opening Talks by Special Guests
1:00 PM - Hacking, Brainstorming session
2:00 PM - Workshops start
8:00 PM - Concert / Demos


Talks

12:00 - 1:30 PM

  • Ken Perlin - The Use of Music and Audio in Immersive Live VR Theater
  • Pran Brandi - Introduction to Immersive Audio
  • Brad Garton, Ethan Edwards & Onur Yıldırım - Integrated Music Generation and Interactive Synthesis
  • Dana Abrassart - Mind, Body, & Sound
  • Charles Berman - Immersive Performance

 

VR Playground
2:00 - 5:00
Audio Fusion Recording Studio Simulation with Sam Fisher, and other demos

 

Workshops

2:00 - 3:30 - Pran Brandi
Introduction to immersive audio.
This workshop introduces techniques for approaching spacial audio, including ambisonics, plugins, and DAW workflow. It is recommended to download the following free software before the workshop:

  • Reaper
  • Unity 2017.1 or newer
  • FB360 Spacial Workstation (v3.0.0 is ideal, but v2.2.1 is fine if their OS is older)
  • Resonance Audio Unity package (just the .unitypackage file is necessary)
  • Resonance Audio VST plugin
  • Ambix VST plugins (just 1st order is necessary)

2:00 - 3:30 - Brad Garton, Ethan Edwards & Onur Yıldırım
Using RTcmix in the Unity Game Development Environment (intermediate level)

4:00 - 5:30 - Nicole Stein
WebVR: Introduction to building VR with A-Frame

4:00 - 5:30 - Brennan McTernan
How spatial audio works, the kinds of microphones and how they work, and how our ears tell our eyes where to look. Attendees should install (free) Unity 2017.2, and bring a laptop with headphones.

 

Demos and Performances
8:00 Presentations and sharing what we made over the course of the day

description.text:
There’s nothing more powerful that can sway your emotions and touch your soul than music. The Power of Music Concert Series, launched by Daniel’s Music Foundation (DMF) and One Vision Music, will be filled with moving performances by Dina Fanai and Bob Kinkel, DMF's Co-Founder Daniel Trush and Music Director Gerard Powers, as well as other special guests. Each performer will share their own personal story on how music has impacted and transformed their lives. All proceeds benefit Daniel’s Music Foundation.
Daniel’s Music Foundation is a non-profit organization that has been using the transformative power of music to create a community built on acceptance, respect and appreciation for individuals with developmental and physical disabilities for over a decade. Programs focus on having members feel accepted both within their community, as well as the greater community at large. For more information please visit danielsmusic.org.
Tickets are $10.00 plus $20.00 food & beverage minimum and can be purchased here.

description.text:
Class A Music Productions is a music production/publishing company that provides musical services and live sound for concerts, plays, CD recordings and special events. Established in the Music City of Nashville, TN, in 1987, relocated to White Plains, NY in 1994, Class A continued to serve a plethora  of various groups such as professional artists, churches,  conventions, conferences and civic organizations.
We are celebrating 30 years of serving the entertainment industry and would love to have you come and celebrate with us. We will have a great buffet, live music, networking, DJ, dancing and tributes from some great clients.
Visit our website at www.ClassAMusicProductions.net for more information. 
Contact us at ClassAMusic@aol.com.

name.text: Getty Music Worship Summit ― New York
name.html: Getty Music Worship Summit ― New York

description.text:
An event for pastors, musicians and church leaders on how worship transforms your congregation, your family and your life. Featuring Keith Getty and friends.
6.:30 - 7:30pm 
On Wednesday, December 20 the Gettys along with other guests will be hosting a Worship Summit at Calvary Church in New York. This is a free event and will include a complimentary lunch and session topics include Created, Commanded & Compelled to Worship, Building Deep Believers Through Congregational Singing, Hymns and Songs for the Journeys of Life and a special time of Q&A with Keith Getty. Every person who attends will receive free music and resources from Getty Music!

name.text: Heifetz Live Auditions @ The Manhattan School of Music
name.html: Heifetz Live Auditions @ The Manhattan School of Music

description.text:
Important Information:
You MUST fill out an application form via GetAcceptd prior to your live audition. You will not be allowed to audition live unless you've submitted an online application. Please click here to do so. If you are auditioning live, you do not need to upload videos to your application.
Heifetz Institute live auditions will take place in various locations around the U.S. 
Instructions:


Select the "ticket" corresponding to the audition time you'd like to sign up for

Pre-formed ensembles applying to the Ashkenasi/Kishbaum Chamber Music Seminar will be seen during the first hour of the audition time block



Please be sure to fill out your information as it is on your GetAcceptd application. If you're signing up for your ensemble, enter your ensemble name in parenthesis after your last name.


Please arrive to the audition site at least 20 minutes prior to your scheduled audition time. There will be a warm up space.



You may choose to bring a collaborative pianist, but this is not a requirement. There will be pianos available at all live audition locations.

name.text: 2018 Saturday Night Soirée - Chamber Music America
name.html: 2018 Saturday Night Soirée - Chamber Music America

description.text:
Join us for an evening of music and celebration! Connect with colleagues from around the country, enjoy a live performance, and applaud as CMA presents its second annual Visionary Award to multi-instrumentalist, educator, and bandleader Jon Batiste.
Featuring jazz trumpeter and composer Etienne Charles Creole Soul and Grammy Award-winning pianist and composer Billy Childs.
Hosted by Etienne Charles
This event is part of CMA's 40th Anniversary Conference; conference registration is not required to attend.
This event is black tie optional.

name.text: Music Mondays - Orion Weiss & Anna Polonsky, Piano Duo
name.html: Music Mondays - Orion Weiss & Anna Polonsky, Piano Duo

description.text:
Orion Weiss & Anna Polonsky Piano Duo
Orion Weiss, piano / Anna Polonsky, Piano
 Major talents Orion Weiss (an Avery Fisher Career grant winner with “virtuosity to spare”, Washington Post) and Anna Polonsky (“someone to watch”, New York Times) come together for a special holiday program, performed on Music Mondays’ new Steinway concert grand piano. Hear Tchaikovsky’s beloved Nutcracker Suite and selections from Liszt’s delightful, little-known cycle The Christmas Tree, and a premiere by Stephen Hartke, among other works.







PROGRAM
Tchaikovsky — Nutcracker Suite
Liszt — Selections from The Christmas Tree
Debussy — Petite Suite
Schumann — Pictures from the East
Hartke — Piano Sonata for Four Hands (New York Premiere)

name.text: Brooklyn Music School Presents: Little Red Riding Hood
name.html: Brooklyn Music School Presents: Little Red Riding Hood

description.text:
The classic transformative tale of "Little Red Riding Hood" will come alive in BMS Playhouse on December 15, 2017. Presented by our young musical theater performers, this imaginative production will feature the classic and original characters highlighting Little Red's journey through the unfamiliar woods and her encounter with the clever trickster wolf. 
This modern interpretation of the classic Grimm's Fairy Tale explores the topics of knowing who to trust, feeling lost and alone, what reasons one might wear costumes and play a different role, manipulation, horrors, and eventually growing up.
Artistic Direction: Lina Tetriani
Stage Direction: Marie Zvosec
Music Director/Composer: Pamela Martinez

name.text: Music at Asbury presents Julia Breanetta Simpson, "How Sweet the Sound"
name.html: Music at Asbury presents Julia Breanetta Simpson, "How Sweet the Sound"

description.text:
Music at Asbury is proud to present our first Black History Month concert featuring vocalist / actress Julia Breanetta Simpson in an exploration of the evolution of American music from slavery to the “Jazz Age.”
New Rochelle resident Julia Breanetta Simpson has appeared around the country at regional, dinner and stock theatres in such productions as Ain't Misbehavin', Dreamgirls, For Colored Girls, One Mo' Time, Tintypes, and When the Nightingale Sings. She has also appeared in off-Broadway theatres and other venues in New York including New World Stages, the Triad, and the Metropolitan Room. Julia earned her BFA degree in Musical Theatre at Syracuse University and is a proud member of AEA, SAG-AFTRA and M.A.C. 
Ms. Simpson performs throughout the Tri-State area in her one-woman shows "Harlem On My Mind," "How Sweet the Sound," “Julia and the Duke,” and her new show, “Classy and Sassy: A Cabaret Tribute to Lena Horne.” Julia Simpson is the founder and CEO of Breanetta Productions, whose mission is to honor and celebrate contributions made to society and world culture by African Americans through plays, musicals, and concerts that inspire, educate and entertain. Her recordings can be found on cdbaby.com.
“[Duke] Ellington once said 'Music is my mistress, and she plays second fiddle to no one.' The same can be said of Julia Breanetta Simpson who led the audience in song, history and dialogue through a glorious evening. Her velvety notes sailed and floated."-The Post Eagle

name.text: Qi & Yun Music Dream presents Path to Juilliard Piano Concert
name.html: Qi & Yun Music Dream presents Path to Juilliard Piano Concert

description.text: Qi & Yun Music Dream is a program that is designed to help young pianist achieving their dream of getting into top music college like Juilliard. Last year, thanks to the effort of our staff and the guidance from some of the world's most famous pianists, we were able to help all of our students getting into their dream school. This year, we are once again to present you the five young pianists that are currently enrolled in our program. These 5 young pianists are among some of the most talented young musicians that we have seen, and they are bringing you their best works. We invite you to witness this memorable moment of these young pianists pursuing their dreams.

These 5 young pianists are among some of the most talented young musicians that we have seen, and they are bringing you their best works. We invite you to witness this memorable moment of these young pianists pursuing their dreams.

name.text: The Music Makers NY: 3rd Annual Valentine's "Play" Acoustic Jam & Wine Event for Singles
name.html: The Music Makers NY: 3rd Annual Valentine's "Play" Acoustic Jam & Wine Event for Singles

description.text:
The Music Makers 3rd Annual Valentines "PLAY" Singles Acoustic Guitar Jam and Sing-Along + Optional Lesson for Beginners. Cash Wine Bar or B.Y.O.B. to Share.





Don’t let this Valentine’s Day slip by without meeting new people, learning something new and tasting new wine! Come meet, sing along and even learn to strum a few chords on guitar as you enjoy wine and introductions to 30-40 new people age 30-55. Guaranteed fun, laughs, new connections plus learning+ wine = Great Valentines Day 2017!


Are you tired of Valentine’s Day events that leave to your own defenses or just don’t deliver at all? 
Why settle on Valentine’s Day 2017? Join in the only Valentine’s Day event designed to make sure you leave with more than what you came with. Sign-up for the completely revolutionary February Fantasy, B.Y.O.-Wine, Anti–Boring, Anti-Average and Ant-"Anything you have ever done before" Valentine’s Day Event, Sing-Along, Guitar Circle, Tasting/Sharing, Mingling Event with Music Makers NY at Smash Studios
 

Why not join in the only Valentine’s Day event hosted by people who will make sure you leave with much more than what you came with: Music Makers NY, The professionals in Helping professionals discover or rediscover music.

 Sign-up for this completely revolutionary Singles Valentines "Play" Event, Feel free to bring wine to share (or not share) or enjoy our cash wine bar. Enjoy meeting new, music-curious people, join in a sing-along, try your hand at playing in the guitar circle, tasting/sharing new wines, mingling, meet and enjoy introductions to each and every guest all at Music Makers NY.


Created just for singles, you will get much more out of this Valentine's Day event than any other!
___________________________________________________________________________________
Take your own events & get together's to the next level!
Would you like your own "Play" party for your friends or office? Call Music Makers NY at 212-239-7054 and get all the details! We bring the acoustic guitars and music teachers who specialize in teaching adults and keeping them engaged. Or Take it to the next level and book a life changing 4-8 week custom workshop to either learn a song together (4 weekly 2 hour sessions with a Berklee School of Music graduate coordinator/path-changer!) or get together with others who play music a bit to focus on 4-6 songs and perform them together on stage. (We provide all the instruments, Berklee graduate coordinator, venue and stage.)

description.text:
Lots of people get inspired after watching the performance “Hamilton” in New York. Alexander Hamilton proved with his example that YOU are a blacksmith of your destiny. Thus, the concept of self-made man will always remain of vital importance. It is one of many significant bull-points highlighted during the show. 
Your friends must have highly recommended watching “Hamilton” thousands of times. Then, why there is no ticket in your pocket? You procrastinate with it till the last moment. Be careful as not to find yourself in a never-ending line. If long lines are not for you, buy “Hamilton” tickets online which are available 24/7 at hamiltontickets.org.
Let’s a bit unveil the curtain of secrecy over the performance. What you should expect from the show? One thing you can be sure about is unforgettable impressions. The atmosphere of the play immediately sends shivers down your spine. The rapped lyrics sung at setting-record speed is a real sight you mustn’t miss. 
Founding Fathers are in front of you, they express their feelings and worries dated back to the dawn of the USA. The multicultural cast dressed in bright costumes will not get out of your head for a while. Moreover, lots of conclusions will be drawn from the performance that are able to change your life forever.

description.text:
Cruel Intentions - The Musical
7:15pm Doors | 8pm Show | Ages 13+, minors must be accompanied by parent or legal guardian
Secret Society Seating: $109.00Table Seating: $79.00Standing Room: $49.00
FIRST LOVE IS A BITTERSWEET SYMPHONY.Cruel Intentions: The Musical pulls you into the manipulative world of Manhattan’s most dangerous liaisons: Sebastian Valmont and Kathryn Merteuil. Seduced by revenge and fueled by passion, the two diabolically charming step-siblings place a bet on whether or not Sebastian can deflower their incoming headmaster’s daughter. As the two set out to destroy the innocent girl –and anyone who gets in their way– they find themselves entangled in a web of secrets, temptation, and the cruelest game of all: love.Based on the classic French novel, Les Liaisons Dangereuses, and the sexiest teen drama of all time, this new musical is a full-on ’90s throwback to when email was for “geeks and pedophiles” and rosaries were more than a fashion statement. Featuring your favorite nostalgia-inducing hits like, “Lovefool,” “Just A Girl,” “Only Happy When It Rains,” and, of course, “Bittersweet Symphony.” Don’t miss the most intoxicating musical in Manhattan. Your reputation depends on it.


Refund Policy & Terms of Service: LPR does not issue refunds or exchanges for ticket purchases. All sales are final. No refunds will be processed for unused tickets or for patrons who are denied entry due to not having valid identification for will call pickup or admittance to an age restricted event. Events are subject to change in date, time, reserved seat location or scheduled act at anytime. In the case of an event cancellation, refunds will be provided via the method of payment originally used. Resale of any ticket at a price greater than the original ticket price is absolutely prohibited. We have the right to revoke or reclaim possession of any tickets from the buyer who violates such restrictions.

name.text: The Broadway Musical- The Book Of Mormon
name.html: The Broadway Musical- The Book Of Mormon

description.text:
The Broadway Musical, The Book of Mormon makes the makers and other directors and producers realize that it is not necessary to portray serious topics in a serious manner all the time. it can even be done while adding a little humor to it, this makes the audience intrigued to learn about the problems in a way that doesn’t bore them or make them yawn while sitting in the theatre. This is the kind of play that makes the time fly by, and you wonder where all the time went. 
This Broadway Musical has been performed in the past as well and received a tremendous amount of appreciation from the audience. This is the kind of musical or play that makes the audience learn the lessons of life, and give a look into the world’s problems through it whilst sitting on their seats in the theatre. The humorous touch to the play makes it really fun and exciting for the audience to watch. It teaches a lesson to the first world country that what problems faced in their country is nothing as what is being faced in places like African villages. It makes the audience realize that life should go beyond the border and everyone who is capable of doing something for the world should play their part. As it will benefit the environment and free the world of a lot of problems and diseases from the face of the earth.
So buy the tickets to Book of Mormon musical, walk in tickets are also welcome and you can also buy the tickets online from the official website as all the information is provided to you there through the user friendly website belonging to the musical play.

FIRST LOVE IS A BITTERSWEET SYMPHONY.

Cruel Intentions: The Musical pulls you into the manipulative world of Manhattan’s most dangerous liaisons: Sebastian Valmont and Kathryn Merteuil. Seduced by revenge and fueled by passion, the two diabolically charming step-siblings place a bet on whether or not Sebastian can deflower their incoming headmaster’s daughter. As the two set out to destroy the innocent girl –and anyone who gets in their way– they find themselves entangled in a web of secrets, temptation, and the cruelest game of all: love.

Based on the classic French novel, Les Liaisons Dangereuses, and the sexiest teen drama of all time, this new musical is a full-on ’90s throwback to when email was for “geeks and pedophiles” and rosaries were more than a fashion statement. Featuring your favorite nostalgia-inducing hits like, “Lovefool,” “Just A Girl,” “Only Happy When It Rains,” and, of course, “Bittersweet Symphony.” Don’t miss the most intoxicating musical in Manhattan. FIRST LOVE IS A BITTERSWEET SYMPHONY.

Cruel Intentions: The Musical pulls you into the manipulative world of Manhattan’s most dangerous liaisons: Sebastian Valmont and Kathryn Merteuil. Seduced by revenge and fueled by passion, the two diabolically charming step-siblings place a bet on whether or not Sebastian can deflower their incoming headmaster’s daughter. As the two set out to destroy the innocent girl –and anyone who gets in their way– they find themselves entangled in a web of secrets, temptation, and the cruelest game of all: love.

Based on the classic French novel, Les Liaisons Dangereuses, and the sexiest teen drama of all time, this new musical is a full-on ’90s throwback to when email was for “geeks and pedophiles” and rosaries were more than a fashion statement. Featuring your favorite nostalgia-inducing hits like, “Lovefool,” “Just A Girl,” “Only Happy When It Rains,” and, of course, “Bittersweet Symphony.” Don’t miss the most intoxicating musical in Manhattan. description.text:
Rebecca Vigil and Evan Kaufman bring their award-winning musical improv show back to Caveat this fall! Here’s how it works:Rebecca and Evan interview a real couple from the audience and then turn their love story into a fully improvised musical.
Doors 6:30pm, show 7:00pm. 21+
“The premise sounds nearly impossible, but the execution is reliably brilliant.” – NY Times 
“4 Stars. F​rom the moment​ Vigil and​ ​Kaufman burst onto the​ ​stage​… ​you know you’re in good hands.” TIME OUT NY 
“Vigil and Kaufman’s hour-long show is bombastic, clean, and ever hysterical.” – The Village Voice
